title: The Atheist and the Acorn The Atheists Motive

content.question: The Atheist’s speech in lines 13-15 suggests that the Atheist wants to

choices.label: encourage the speaker to acknowledge his viewpoint about atheism
demonstrate a universal law by testing the plants’ difference in weight
prove both how intelligent he is and show off his ideas on redesigning the physical world
demonstrate both how wrong the speaker is and how he would interpret events differently

content.answer: prove both how intelligent he is and show off his ideas on redesigning the physical world

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
